header.subtitle: Enjoy peace of mind while our experts take care of everything.
header.description: Are you tired of the hassle and stress of tax season? Look no further! Our Smart Tax App is here to revolutionize the way you file your taxes. Say goodbye to complicated forms, endless paperwork, and uncertain calculations. With our cutting-edge app, we make tax filing quick, convenient, and accurate while saving you money.

why_tax_app.title: Why MYTAXAPP?
why_tax_app.subtitle: FOR TAXPAYERS
why_tax_app.text1: Save money ! Get competitive quotes from tax professionals from across the nation.
why_tax_app.text2: Save time with easy to use safe and secure data collection.
why_tax_app.text3: Lists and checklists to follow up on your to do list.
why_tax_app.text4: Automated reminders for missing information and appointment scheduling made easy.
why_tax_app.text5: Upload digital tax documents from your  desktop or phone.
why_tax_app.text6: Use the ChatBot for frequently asked questions.
why_tax_app.text7: Check on the status of your returns, and much more.

step3.title: Hire the right professional

item1.text: MYTAXAPP helped us save many hours of repetitive admin work. We were able to hire more tax preparers instead and increase our capacity to prepare more returns for higher margins and profit.

item2.text: With MYTAXAPP we received more completed tax organizers than ever before. In the past clients rarely completed the tax organizer or partially completed them which meant that our staff had to follow up with the client by spending extra time communicating and documenting the required information. With MYTAXAPP all of that was done automatically with the smart tax organizer and the built-in reminder notifications. Thank you MYTAXAPP

item3.text: We were able to get additional new clients with MYTAXAPP’s tax preparer platform. Taxpayers would request services and members would bid for the proposed work. We won several bids and got some very well-paying clients. Most of all the automated appointment and payment system helped us rethink of how we are scheduling our appointments.

marketing.title: Sign Up for the MYTAXAPP newsletter to stay up to date

landing_expert.title: Tax Pros
landing_expert.subtitle: Join Our Platform and Showcase Your Skills
landing_expert.description1: Are you an experienced and skilled tax professional looking to increase profit margins while leveraging the power of tech and AI? Are you looking for new opportunities to showcase your expertise?
landing_expert.description2: Look no further! Our Platform is the perfect place for you to connect with clients who need your professional tax services. Join our network of tax professionals and take your firm to new profit heights.
landing_expert.video_sub_title: Grow your practice with advanced data collection tools and expand your target market.
landing_expert.sub_description_1: Significantly reduce client data collection and file organization time.  Repetitive administrative tasks are automated freeing up firm resources to provide higher margin services.
landing_expert.sub_description_2: Younger more tech savvy clients expect and demand a seamless experience for tax preparation. Modernizing your practice is the most effective way to both stay competitive and grow your practice into the future. Explore some wonderful perks and learn more about why the platform is an essential tax preparation tool for existing clients and for the new generation.
landing_expert.sub_description_3: Let the once painful task of gathering documents for tax preparation be a distant memory. MYTAXAPP’s integrated data collection functionality gives a channel to upload, organize, and file necessary documentation from various sources. The build in smart tax organizer feature makes completing the required annual data easier and more manageable for your clients thereby increasing interaction and completion rates. It’s like having your robot assistant do the repetitive administration work for you!
landing_expert.sub_description_4: Tax preparation isn’t a one-size fits all process. Now you can enjoy a platform that provides clients with custom portals that neatly tailor to their tax filing needs. Communicate better, gather documents effortlessly, and give the process a more interpersonal touch.
landing_expert.sub_description_5: Save on tasks that often would consume too much time and money. MYTAXAPP automates actions such as tax status updates, requests for information, data entry, and much more. Running a tax preparation business would feel like waving a magic wand around the room.
landing_expert.sub_title_6: Additional New Features and tools using AI
landing_expert.sub_description_6: Our work to create safe and beneficial AI requires a deep understanding of the potential risks and benefits, as well as careful consideration of the impact. We will continuously work to implement AI in the development of new features for both the tax payer and tax pro.
landing_expert.sub_description_7: Our tax professional directory allows you to create your firm’s customizable profile to be included in our directory of tax professionals allowing you to be found by taxpayers searching for a smarter way to prepare their taxes. With our digital solutions you can expand your target market to include taxpayers who want to work digitally and remotely greatly expanding your visibility to potentially millions of new clients both domestically and internationally.

gift.title: You have unlocked a fun fact about taxes. Take a look while we match your responses with the right professionals
gift.description: Astronaut Jack Swigert, the command module pilot for Apollo 13, got the assignment at the last minute because of health issues another astronaut was experiencing. In the rush, Swigert neglected to file his taxes. According to the transcript of the moment he realized his mistake, the crew on the ground thought he was joking, but Swigert was seriously asking how to file an extension.

about.title_2: Reduce Tax Preparation Workload, Jumpstart Productivity, and Increase Profit.
about.title_3: An innovative cloud based tax platform for tax preparation and seamless client communication.
about.title_4: MYTAXAPP is the gift that keeps on giving.
about.title_7: 3. Enjoy a robust suite of tax tools in a few simple clicks.
about.title_8: Discover the most streamlined platform for tax professionals.
about.description_1: MYTAXAPP The first smart digital office tool for tax and accounting firms was  developed by a CPA with over 20 years to accounting and tax compliance  experience.  During his experience in large public accounting firms Ara Haddadian  had a passion to revolutionize the accounting and tax work by using technology to  automate and streamline workflow processes.  He always had a vision to start his  own firm and implement his own tools, processes and procedures to create an all- digital practice.  In 2011 he started his practice in Burbank, CA.  Over the years, his  clients have greatly appreciated and welcomed his approach to the all-digital firm  by embracing the use of digital files, secure portals, digital organizers, and  automated scheduling.  With the rapid advancement of software development and  mobile application technology he started to develop ideas for MYTAXAPP through  his own interactions with his clients and internal project workflow experiences.  Ara  always strived to improve the client experience while creating efficiencies in  gathering accounting and tax data to efficiently manage the improve results for  both the client and his own practice.  The development of MYTAXAPP is a result of  all those years managing his own practice and building on that growth.
about.description_2: MYTAXAPP is the most effortless tax preparation platform businesses have  long wanted. Discover the most powerful toolset to manage clients and automate administrative tasks.
about.description_3: Get customized tax tools in three easy steps.
about.description_4: It’s easy to sign up and get started. All you need to do is register a profile  with us, choose a plan, and before you know it, you’ll have access to a powerful intelligent platform that almost does the work for you.
about.description_5: Every client has their own needs and unique tax preparation requirements. MYTAXAPP exists to address those individual requirements by automating the administrative repetitive tasks of tax preparation. Quickly and easily import your client lists into our platform to begin the process.
about.description_6: They call us the ‘smart tax organizer’ for a reason. Never before have tax professionals seen a platform do so much with so little effort. Gather only necessary information, enhance client communication with, and streamline preparation.
about.description_7: No reason a tax preparation platform shouldn’t act like magic, so we made  one. MYTAXAPP offers professionals a better way to operate their business,  with features and functions that turn messy client workflows into the most  refreshing, customized experiences. Maximize productivity and give your  firm a competitive edge with our incredible cloud-based tax platform for tax  preparation

Company reserves the right, in its sole discretion and at its own expense, to assume the exclusive defense and control of any claims. You agree to reasonably cooperate as requested by Company in the defense of any claims.
condition.ul_condition_7_0: a. Purpose. The term Dispute means any dispute, claim, or controversy between you and the Company or any of our Related Parties regarding the Platform, whether based in contract, statute, regulation, ordinance, tort (including, but not limited to, fraud, misrepresentation, fraudulent inducement, or negligence), or any other legal or equitable theory, and includes the validity, enforceability or scope of this Section (with the exception of the enforceability of the Class Action Waiver clause below). Dispute; is to be given the broadest possible meaning that will be enforced. If you have a Dispute with the Company or any Related Party or any of our or their officers, directors, employees or agents that cannot be resolved through negotiation within the time frame described in the Notice of Dispute clause below, other than those matters listed in the Exclusions from Arbitration clause, you and the entity that you have a Dispute with agree to seek resolution of the Dispute only through arbitration of that Dispute in accordance with the terms of this Section, and not litigate any Dispute in court. Arbitration means that the Dispute will be resolved by a neutral arbitrator instead of in a court by a judge or jury. Any Dispute will be governed by the Limitation of Liability in provided in this Agreement.
condition.ul_condition_7_1: b. Exclusions from Arbitration. Either you or the Company can seek to have a Dispute resolved in small claims court if all the requirements of the small claims court are satisfied. Either you or the Company may seek to have a Claim resolved in small claims court in your county of residence or the small claims court in closest proximity to your residence, and you may also bring a Claim in small claims court in the Superior Court of California, County of Los Angeles.
condition.ul_condition_7_2: c. Notice of Dispute. If you have a dispute with the Company or Related Party, you must send written notice to 290 E. Verdugo Ave., Suite 204, Burbank, CA 91502 to give the Company or Related Party you have a dispute with the opportunity to resolve the dispute informally through negotiation. You agree to negotiate resolution of the Dispute in good faith for no less than 60 days after you provide notice of the Dispute. If we or our affiliate you have a Dispute with does not resolve your Dispute within 60 days from receipt of notice of the Dispute, you, the Company or Related Party have a Dispute with may pursue your claim in arbitration.
condition.ul_condition_7_3: d. Class Action Waiver. Any dispute resolution proceedings, whether in arbitration or court, will be conducted only on an individual basis not and not in a class or representative action or as a named or unnamed member in a class, consolidated, representative or private attorney general legal action, unless both you and the entity with which you have a dispute specifically agree to do so in writing following initiation of the arbitration.
condition.ul_condition_7_4: e. Initiation of Arbitration Proceeding/Selection of Arbitrator. If you or the entity you have a Dispute with elect to resolve your Dispute through arbitration, the party initiating the arbitration proceeding may initiate it with the American Arbitration Association (AAA), www.adr.org, or JAMS www.jamsadr.com. The terms of this section govern in the event they conflict with the rules of the arbitration organization selected by the parties.
condition.ul_condition_7_5: f. Arbitration Procedures. Because the Platform provided to you by the Company concerns interstate commerce, the  Arbitration Act (FAA) governs the arbitrability of all Disputes. However, applicable federal or state law may also apply to the substance of any Disputes. For claims of less than $75,000, the AAA's Supplementary Procedures for Consumer-Related Disputes (Supplementary Procedures) shall apply including the schedule of arbitration fees set forth in Section C-8 of the Supplementary Procedures; for claims over $75,000, the AAA's Commercial Arbitration Rules and relevant fee schedules for non-class action proceedings shall apply. The AAA rules are available at www.adr.org or by calling 1-800-778-7879. Further, if your claims do not exceed $75,000 and you provided notice to and negotiated in good faith with the entity you had a Dispute with as described above, if the arbitrator finds that you are the prevailing party in the arbitration, you will be entitled to recover reasonable attorneys; fees and costs as determined by the arbitrator, in addition to any rights to recover the same under controlling state or federal law afforded to the entity you have a Dispute with or you. The arbitrator will make any award in writing but need not provide a statement of reasons unless requested by a party. Such award will be binding and final, except for any right of appeal provided by the FAA, and may be entered in any court having jurisdiction over the parties for purposes of enforcement.
condition.ul_condition_7_6: g. Location of Arbitration. You or the entity you have a Dispute with may initiate arbitration in either Los Angeles, California or the county in which you reside. In the event that you select the county of your residence, the entity you have a Dispute with may transfer the arbitration to Los Angeles, California in the event that it agrees to pay any additional fees or costs you incur as a result of the change in location as determined by the arbitrator.
condition.ul_condition_7_7: h. Severability. If any clause within this Disputes section (other than the Class Action Waiver clause above) is found to be illegal or unenforceable, that clause will be severed from this section, and the remainder of this section will be given full force and effect. If the Class Action Waiver clause is found to be illegal or unenforceable, this entire section will be unenforceable, and the Dispute will be decided by a court and you and the entity you have a dispute with each agree to waive in that instance, to the fullest extent allowed by law, any trial by jury.
condition.ul_condition_7_8: i. Continuation. This Section shall survive any termination of this Terms of Service or the provision of the associated services to you.
condition.ul_condition_8_0: a. Governing Law. California law and the Federal Arbitration Act will govern all disputes arising out of or relating to the Platform, this Agreement and any Additional Terms, regardless of conflict of laws rules.
condition.ul_condition_8_1: b. Global Trade and Export Restrictions. You agree that you and anyone who uses the Platform, including the related website, online services and mobile application, are not prohibited from using the Platform under the laws and regulations of the U.S. or other applicable jurisdiction. For example, you are not on the U.S. Treasury Department’s list of Specially Designated Nationals or any other similar prohibition. You agree that you will comply with these export control and sanctions laws and regulations  and will not transfer or provide any part of the Platform, in violation of these laws and regulations, directly or indirectly.

This Agreement supersedes all prior or contemporaneous communications, whether electronic, oral or written, between you and the Company with respect to its subject matter and you represent that you have not relied on any such communications in accepting this Agreement.

Assignment: Company may assign, sub-contract or otherwise deal with Company’s rights and/or obligations under this Agreement, in whole or in part, upon thirty (30) days prior written notice. You may not assign, transfer or sublicense this agreement or any or all of your rights or obligations under this Agreement.

terms.title: MYTAXAPP PRIVACY POLICY
terms.paragraph0: We take your privacy very seriously. Please read this privacy policy carefully as it contains important information on who we are, how and why we collect, store, use, and share your personal information. It also explains your rights in relation to your personal information and how to contact us or supervisory authorities in the event you have a complaint.
terms.paragraph1: We collect, use and are responsible for certain personal information about you. When we do so we are subject to various laws in the United States and the General Data Protection Regulation which applies across the European Union (including in the United Kingdom), and we are responsible as “controller” of that personal information for the purposes of those laws.

terms.key_terms_2: <0>{{info}}</0> We may collect and use the following personal information that identifies, relates to, describes, is reasonable capable of being associated with, or could reasonably be linked, directly or indirectly, with a particular consumer or household:
terms.decription_table_2: This personal information is required to provide services to you. If you do not provide personal information we ask for, it may delay or prevent us from providing services to you.
terms.key_terms_3: <0>{{info}}</0> We collect most of this personal information directly from you—in person, by telephone, text or email and/or via our website and apps. However, we may also collect information:
terms.ul_terms_3_0: From publicly accessible sources (e.g., property records);
terms.ul_terms_3_1: Directly from a third party (e.g., sanctions screening providers, credit reporting agencies, or customer due diligence providers);
terms.ul_terms_3_2: From a third party with your consent (e.g., your bank);
terms.ul_terms_3_3: From cookies on our website; and
terms.ul_terms_3_5: Automated monitoring of our websites and other technical systems, such as our  computer networks and connections, CCTV and access control systems, communications systems, email and instant messaging systems.
terms.key_terms_4: <0>{{info}}</0> Under data protection law, we can only use your personal information if we have a proper reason for doing so, e.g.,
terms.ul_terms_4_0: To comply with our legal and regulatory obligations;
terms.ul_terms_4_1: For the performance of our contract with you or to take steps at your request before entering into a contract;
terms.ul_terms_4_2: For our legitimate interests or those of a third party; or
terms.key_terms_decription:
A legitimate interest is when we have a business or commercial reason to use your information, so long as this is not overridden by your own rights and interests. 

  The table below explains what we use (process) your personal information for and our reasons for doing so:

Conducting checks to identify our customers and verify their identity

terms.key_table_3_3: Gathering and providing information required by or relating to audits, enquiries or investigations by IRS and/or state tax agency rules and regulations.
terms.key_table_3_4: Ensuring business policies are adhered to, e.g. policies covering security and internet use
terms.key_table_3_5: Operational reasons, such as improving efficiency, training and quality control
terms.key_table_3_6: Ensuring the confidentiality of commercially sensitive information
terms.key_table_3_7: Statistical analysis to help us manage our business, e.g. in relation to our financial performance, customer base, product range or other efficiency measures
terms.key_table_3_8: Preventing unauthorized access and  modifications to systems

terms.key_terms_5: <0>{{info}}</0> We may use your personal information to send you updates (by email, text message, telephone or post) about our services including exclusive offers, promotions or new products AND/OR services.
terms.terms_5_decription_1: We have a legitimate interest in processing your personal information for promotional  purposes (see above “How and why we use your personal information”). This means we do not usually need your consent to send you promotional communications. However, where consent is needed, we will ask for this consent separately and clearly. We will always treat your personal information with the utmost respect and never sell OR share it with other organizations for marketing purposes.  You have the right to opt out of receiving promotional communications at any time by:
terms.ul_terms_5_1: Using the “unsubscribe” link in emails or “STOP” number in texts; or
terms.ul_terms_5_2: updating your marketing preferences on our www.mytaxapp.ai.
terms.terms_5_decription_2: We may ask you to confirm or update your marketing preferences if you instruct us to provide further products AND/OR services in the future, or if there are changes in the law, regulation, or the structure of our business.
terms.key_terms_6: <0>{{info}}</0> We routinely share personal information with:
terms.ul_terms_6_0: The Internal Revenue Service and state tax agencies;
terms.ul_terms_6_1: Service providers we use to help deliver our products and/or services to you, such as payment service providers, website hosts, software developers;
terms.ul_terms_6_2: Other third parties we use to help us run our business, such as marketing agencies;
terms.terms_6_decription_1:
We only allow our service providers to handle your personal information if we are satisfied, they take appropriate measures to protect your personal information. We also impose contractual obligations on service providers relating to ensure they can only use your personal information to provide services to us and to you. We may also share personal  information with external auditors, e.g., in relation to ISO accreditation and the audit of our  accounts. 

  We may disclose and exchange information with law enforcement agencies and regulatory  bodies to comply with our legal and regulatory obligations. 

 We may also need to share some personal information with other parties, such as potential buyers of some or all of our business or during a re-structuring. We will typically anonymize information, but this may not always be possible. The recipient of the information will be bound by confidentiality obligations. 

  We will not share your personal information with any other third party.
terms.key_terms_7: <0>{{info}}</0> In the preceding 12 months, we have not sold personal information.
terms.terms_7_decription: In the preceding 12 months, we have disclosed for a business purpose to one or more third parties the following categories of personal information that identifies, relates to, describes, is capable of being associated with, or could reasonably be linked, directly or indirectly, with a particular consumer or household:
terms.ul_terms_7_0: Identifiers (e.g., a real name, alias, postal address, unique personal identifier, onlineidentifier, Internet Protocol address, email address, account name, social security number, driver’s license number, passport number, or other similar identifiers);
terms.ul_terms_7_1: Information that identifies, relates to, describes, or is capable of being associated with, a particular individual, including, but not limited to, his or her name, signature, social security number, physical characteristics or description, address, telephone number, passport number, driver’s license or state identification card number, insurance policy number, education, employment, employment history, bank account  number, credit card number, debit card number, or any other financial information, medical information, or health insurance information;
terms.ul_terms_7_2: Commercial information (e.g., records of personal property, products or services purchased, obtained, or considered, or other purchasing or consuming histories or tendencies);
terms.ul_terms_7_3: Internet or other electronic network activity information (e.g., browsing history, search history, and information regarding a consumer’s interaction with an Internet Web site, application, or advertisement);
terms.key_terms_8: <0>{{info}}</0> Information may be held at our offices and those of our service providers, representatives and agents as described above (see above: “Who We Share Your Personal Information with”).
terms.terms_8_decription: Some of these third parties may be based outside the European Economic Area. For more information, including on how we safeguard your personal information when this occurs, see below: “Transferring Your Personal Information Out of the EEA”.
terms.key_terms_9: <0>{{info}}</0>  We will keep your personal  information while you have an account with us or while we are providing services to you. Thereafter, we will keep your personal information for as long as is necessary:
terms.ul_terms_9_0: To respond to any questions, complaints or claims made by you or on your behalf;
terms.ul_terms_9_1: To show that we treated you fairly; or
terms.ul_terms_9_2: To keep records required by law.
terms.terms_9_decription: We will not retain your personal information for longer than necessary for the purposes set out in this policy. Different retention periods apply for different types of personal information, including a seven-year retention requirement for tax information.
terms.key_terms_10: <0>{{info}}</0> Our services relate to preparation of tax documents for customers primarily in the United States, however it may be possible to access our services from the EEA. If you are located in the EEA, it is necessary for us to store and/or share your personal information outside the European Economic Area (EEA), e.g.:
terms.ul_terms_10_0: With our offices outside the EEA;
terms.ul_terms_10_1: With your and our service providers located outside the EEA;
terms.ul_terms_10_2: If you are based outside the EEA; or
terms.ul_terms_10_3: United States based tax authorities, specifically the Internal Revenue Service and state tax authorities.
terms.terms_10_decription:
These transfers are subject to special rules under European and UK data protection law. 
 Non-EEA countries do not have the same data protection laws as the United Kingdom and EEA. We will, however, ensure the transfer complies with data protection law and all personal information will be secure. Our standard practice is to use standard data protection contract clauses that have been approved by the European Commission. To obtain a copy of those clauses, email our privacy email at [privacy email address]. 

 If you would like further information, please contact us or our Data Protection Officer (see “How To Contact Us” below).
terms.terms_11_decription: For further information on each of those rights, including the circumstances in which they apply, see the guidance from the UK Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) on individual rights under the General Data Protection Regulation.
terms.key_table_4_7: Right Not to be Subject to Automated Individual Decision-Making

terms.key_terms_13: <0>{{info}}</0> We have appropriate security measures in place to prevent personal information from being accidentally lost or used or accessed in an unauthorized way. We limit access to your personal information to those who have a genuine business need to access it. Those processing your information will do so only in an authorized manner and are subject to a duty of confidentiality. We also have procedures in place to deal with any suspected data security breach. We will notify you and any applicable regulator of a suspected data security breach where we are legally required to do so.
terms.key_terms_14: <0>{{info}}</0> If you would like to exercise any of your rights as described in this Privacy Policy, please:
terms.ul_terms_14_0: Complete a data subject request form available on our website at www.mytaxapp.ai;
terms.key_terms_14_decription: Please note that you may only make a CCPA-related data access or data portability disclosure request twice within a 12-month period. If you choose to contact directly by website/email/phone/in writing, you will need to provide  us with:
terms.ul_terms_14_3: Enough information to identify you (e.g., your account username and password);
terms.ul_terms_14_4: Proof of your identity (e.g., a copy of your driving license or passport);
terms.ul_terms_14_6: A description of what right you want to exercise and the information to which your request relates.
terms.key_terms_14_decription_2:
We are not obligated to make a data access or data portability disclosure if we cannot verify  that the person making the request is the person about whom we collected information, or is someone authorized to act on such person’s behalf. 

 Any personal information we collect from you to verify your identity in connection with you request will be used solely for the purposes of verification.
terms.key_terms_15:
<0>{{info}}</0>  We hope that we or our Data Protection Officer can resolve any query or concern you raise about our use of your information. 

 The General Data Protection Regulation also gives you right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority, in the European Union (or European Economic Area) state where you work, normally live, or where any alleged infringement of data protection laws occurred. The supervisory authority in Ireland is the entity who may be contacted at Data Protection Commission 21 Fitzwilliam Square South, Dublin 2, D02 RD28, Ireland, 01 7650100 / 1800437 737, https://forms.dataprotection.ie/contact.

step7.description1: <0>{{note}}</0> If you itemize your deductions for a taxable year on Schedule A (Form 1040), Itemized Deductions, you may be able to deduct expenses you paid that year for medical and dental care for yourself, your spouse, and your dependents. You may deduct only the amount of your total medical expenses that exceed 7.5% of your adjusted gross income. You figure the amount you're allowed to deduct on Schedule A (Form 1040). Medical care expenses include payments for the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease, or payments for treatments affecting any structure or function of the body.
